name: Clay Golem
description: The Clay Golem is a towering figure made entirely of malleable clay. It has a strong presence, resembling a humanoid statue brought to life through magic.
memorable: Its ability to regenerate while absorbing acid damage and cause Golem's Plague makes it a formidable enemy.
goals: Typically serves as a guardian for temples or wizards' lairs, protecting areas and objects of power.
relations: Often created and controlled by powerful wizards or artificers, may coexist with other constructs.
environment: Commonly found in temples, wizard towers, or hidden lairs.
strengths: Regenerates from acid damage, immune to nonmagical damage, and has numerous resistances.
weaknesses: Has a notable weakness to fire damage, which temporarily reduces its movement and capabilities.
attacks: Deals significant melee damage with slam attacks, has the capacity to push back or knock enemies prone.
most_powerful_ability: Acid Absorption allows the golem to heal from acid damage instead of taking damage.
additional_information: Can go berserk when low on hit points, attacking indiscriminately.
Immutable Form provides immunity to any spell that would change its shape.
Magic Resistance grants advantage on saves against spells, enhancing its resilience.
Can mold its hand into different weapons for various damage types.
Regains hit points from acid damage dealt to it.
